The actors do nothing to bring their characters to life, they just seem like peses being moved around the set by the cretin of a director, at the end Steven Dorf's character Gallantly scarifies himself to save the others, although instead of the oh how heroic to face certain death to save his friends reaction that it should have gotten it was, more what's he doing? Why didn't they just put the bomb on a timer in the first place? And where did all the people go at the end? Pleas don't make a sequel.The Action sequences (I'll get on to why on earth this film had action sequences later) were incredibly bad, the fight at the begging between Edward and the Zombie dude was so badly filmed/ edited, the scenes were over exposed, jerky, and cut together so fast you had no idea what was going on and if you tired to follow it you got a hernia. (One minor fob with this sequence: When Eddy shoots the Zombie he fires one round, when you get the Matrix slow (yes they used Matrix slowmo's) the ice shatters just before the bullet passes through it. OK so I am being really picky.) A later sequence where the 713 agents are in a gun battle with Zombies and I think one of the creatures is so dark you ant make out what is supposed to be happening, and moist of the scene is just badly framed shots of people shooting guns with really OTT badly ked CG mussel flairs.This was surprised to be a horror/ thriller, it isn't. You can tell this by the presents of a car chance, who in their right mind puts a car chance in a horror film. Also my opinion it's not relay that scary when the good gives have rail guns. It doesn't really build up suspense very well, mostly because that would require it making sense. OK keeping the viewer in the dark (forgive the pun) is what makes a good thriller but what is tolled needs to make sense, and possibly not give in the form of mini essay on the backstay, which really should have been expanded up on more.After saying all that the first half dose a passable impression of being an alright horror/ thriller, but the second half dose far to good an impression of a B rated action flick, which really dose spoil it.Some of the CG was done quite well though, I really liked the affect when Eddy shoots the monster with the light resin (where the hell did that come from, they could have at least thought of a plausible explanation for that) the affect was nice, although in my opinion it went down far to easily. The monsters themselves did seem reminiscent of Alone in the Dark 4's monsters, although thy were part plant (don't ask me).All in all it could have been good, the plot when it maid sense, and I needed a piece of paper and post its to make it make sense, was good and had potential.In fact that is my main opinion of this film it had so match potential, it just didn't live up to it. In my opinion Uewi Biol should be hung drawn and quartered.Really don't pay good money to see it but if it comes round on TV then its worth a look, if just to laugh at how bad the acting is.

reviews.review_title: Great Disappointment
reviews.content: The film is not what I expected. I am a great fan of the Alone in the Dark games serial but this film is a typical Hollywood commercial movie. I rated it with two points because the only great thing is its soundtrack. Edward Carnby and Aline Cedrac were OK designed but there are too much action sequences that are déjà vu. These sequences are with U.S. special agents and helicopters involved. This is exaggerate and it offends true game fans! Also, there aren't neither Alan nor Obed Morton! They are very important characters in the original game and without them film is really boring. I really hope that it will be made a film based on Alone in the Dark 1,2 and 3 and that it will be based on original games.

reviews.review_title: Entertaining at times - but for all the wrong reasons
reviews.content: Alone in the Dark is a really bad film. Really bad.The story is very confusing and you can see how Uwe and his crew tried to fix that part by throwing in a long text roll in the beginning. Here, of course, you get to know the basic story which is incredibly lame. Some mad evil guy who experiments with orphans... blah blah. Another big problem is how the movie is nothing like you expect it to be. You might think it's a horror film, but Uwe Boll has filled this film with over-the-top and out of place special effects. I'll give you an example. The beginning of the film is PACKED with slow-motion sequences which are very unnecessary, in one sequence the bad guy who chases Edward pushes and old man who slightly stumbles, all in slow motion. The rest of the film is filled with scenes where the weird agency who investigates electro-magnetic pulses fights off hordes of weird scorpion monsters which are an incredible rip-off of Alien. The monsters look like the monster from Alien, which is called a Xenomorph. But in this film the monsters are called Xenoms. Wow, the difference is huge.Also, I have never seen a movie with less developed characters. Seriously, all you get to know about anyone is the fact that Edward grew up in an orphanage. Otherwise you basically get a name, I can remember three or four characters, even though I know nothing about them, which really made me uninterested if they would meet their fate. Casting Tara Reid as a scientist is the weirdest decision ever.2/10

reviews.review_title: Don't try to be creative when you are not
reviews.content: Alone in the Dark sounds good on paper. Dorff and Slater in a movie, both good actors. Then mix in Tara Reid, a young hottie. If all the pieces fell into place, it could have been a good movie. So what happened? Uwe Boll.I think he is trying so hard to make the movie cool, and you can see that in his attempt to put in "cool" action sequences. His use of tracers on the guns (bullet that lights up so you see where you shoot) is pretty amazing. Not amazing in a good way, but he even uses it in a pistol. I'm sure if they were shooting with paint-ball guns in this movie, he'd still use tracers.The acting, story and dialog is very weak, the intro has a bunch of text being read by some man and it seems to take forever to go through it. The first few minutes of the movie tries to give you all sorts of information, but it's so false and stupid I actually wondered how these actors could agree to do this flick. The movie also has lots and lots of flaws, it's just too much to get into, but it's all there. Unfortunately for Tara Reid, she is the worst actor in this movie, she's good looking but it seems she's just there to have a girl in the picture, she doesn't say much so she's just along for the ride.I would also like to give my award to this movie for the worst sex scene in history of movies. It came out of nowhere and did nothing for the characters, they just continued like nothing ever happened. The chemistry between Slater and Reid's characters is so bad they could have removed one character and you'd never know. Even if Slater were carrying a skull instead of Tara Reid, you'd never know.Then there is the sound and music, I'm pretty sure I've heard the music somewhere before and the sounds are somewhat boring. A few times it does pretty well, but most of the time it's just boring and doesn't work.Uwe Boll's "House of the dead" tried to be creative and maybe even tried to bring something new to this genre of movies, it failed. "Alone in the Dark" is basically "House of the dead" with other actors and different setting. If you compare both of them, you'll see that they are very similar, and the ending really shows just that. I really hope this isn't a standard ending in his movies, it might be his message to the world: "The evil won't stop" which can also mean "I won't stop" - which to me, is even worse than having monsters and zombies running around the streets.

reviews.review_title: this movie is, in a word: HORRIBLE!
reviews.content: Based on the video game, or so they say. I HAVE played A.I.T.D., well, the 1st one that is. Other than a few of the characters, the movie had no reference to the game. The so called zombies that attack them in that museum look like the infected from 28 days later and THAT movie was better than this one. Do you remember those swat cops from the game? I sure don't. As for those long tailed monsters in the movie, do you remember those from the game? I don't. Overall I really thought the movie was boring. Plus it had a crappy ending. When this movie was released, it only lasted a week in the theaters, literally. It apparently didn't make enough money so I suppose they took it out.

reviews.review_title: the best part of this movie is...
reviews.content: ...the DVD special features Behind the Scenes. Of course it doesn't beat 'I heart Huccabees' for embarrassing behind the scenes interviews, but comes close. Yes, the best part of really bad bad movies is the interviews - I mean, once you're captured on video exclaiming enthusiastically how wonderful a movie is, there's no turning back is there? In fact there's not much credibility left. At least Dusitn Hoffman in I heart H and a few other actors express their concerns at the director throwing away the script, so only the idiot director is left exclaiming how wonderful that awful awful movie is. But in this flick (as in give it the flick) they all rave about it, and they're probably not on drugs. Christian Slater, with all the sensitivity of a brick, purrs (during the interview when a bad actor is screaming in the background) that it is 'Purrfection!'.And a special mention to groanmeister Stephen Dorff (he even beats Stephen Segal) - if they ever need an actor to play someone suffering from severe constipation for an hour and a half, he's your man!

reviews.review_title: This Is The Worst Game Adaptation Movie Ever
reviews.content: I think my 10 year old nephew could do a better job at putting together a more coherent script. I thought the premise had lots of potential but that idea was soon blown out of the water. Tara Ried's character, as well as her acting, was laughable. To me the most memorable scene in the movie is when the Asian female operative is killed in the mine. Not that the kill scene was memorable, the fact that her head moved and she started to rise as the last actor exited the scene. I reversed the DVD three times just to make sure my eyes weren't playing tricks on me. What a pathetic job of editing. Luckily I paid less than $1 for this DVD, it will make a good coaster for my coffee table I think. What has happened to the Christian Slater of True Romance/Heathers days?

reviews.review_title: Light should never have been shed on this darkness
reviews.content: If you decide to watch this movie you can expect completely out of place one liners, a shallow plot (at best), and a complete lack of character development. I watched this movie hoping it would be funny, in a bad way. At times it was, but the rest of my viewing experience I just couldn't help but wonder what in the hell Bole was thinking when he made this movie. Eventually I just started to get a migraine trying to comprehend Bole's ... er ... "art". Watching this movie was like shoving a razer blade up my urethra.I think this movie is some sort of sick practical joke intended to make the viewer feel stupid for even trying to make sense of it. Maybe for even watching it. It sure made me feel that way. After watching this movie I feel as though someone opened the top of my head, squatted down, took a huge dump into the area which my brain once occupied, and sealed my head back up again.

reviews.review_title: Evil Awakens - I looked at it and it's name was ... Uwe Boll.
reviews.content: OK - this movie was probably THE worst "THING" of my entire life - no kidding , and I have seen way-better directed MIME performances on sidewalks. This is not art , this is not entertainment either, this is not even bad , you know , like the movies they are so bad they're funny ? what were they thinking making this pile of dung ? I can only call this movie "An Atrocity"And to think that in the series of Game-to-Movie masterpieces (!) by Uwe Toilet-Boll , the original Alone In The Dark game had the best story for adaptation and the best atmosphere - it wasn't that hard - they could have just taken the Intro sequences out of the game and put them together with real people as a movie - it would have been soon much better.To Uwe Boll : please , kindly sir - Eat mice poison and die ! although I'm pretty sure you can't even do THAT right. this is the only way to repent your sins against humanity.I swear to god , at this rate if you ever going to touch cool games like Metal Gear Solid tell me now and I will hunt you down myself.

reviews.review_title: Plastic , silly-cone and bad-lighting
reviews.content: Oh my word .... I can't believe I sat through a whole 90 minutes of that Sense abusing rubbish . This is not the first time I REALLY-REALLY wanted to see a movie , because the marketing was good , the trailers rocked and everything seems WOW , and then , you see the title credits begin , you see the name MGF , and you know ..... Okay , I wasted my money . The characters had absolutely no depth , the story-line was insulting (like the underground lab was closed in the 60's , but there was a modern computer screen down there under all the dust and cobwebs). Someone , please do something about good actors who fall for crappy roles .

reviews.review_title: don't waste money on this!
reviews.content: This movie is really really bad. Even bad movies I can deal with, but this one.. let's say it's 'starship troopers' meets 'tremors' meets 'point black' meets 300 other movies.. it's really really bad.. sorry Stephen, and Christian.. cause I like them.. but this one will be going down as their Hollywood mistake, let's just hope they got a new car out of it or a nice vacation.. away from the public eye..the story is thin.. but even that, it's retarded.. the explanation is just ludicrous.. OK, so it's a video game..I will watch resident evil 1 and 2 over and over again, instead of this cow patty.. it's really horrible.. and the MUSIC, oh lord, don't get me started..

reviews.review_title: Brill-freakin'-iant
reviews.content: Watching Alone in the Dark was the best movie going experience of last year. Sure it was god-awful. But it's the kind of god awful that leaves you gasping for breath. What was the budget on it? 20 million? Can you believe someone shelled out money for this? Well, sure they did. And I'm sure in the end, it made it's money. Whether watching the 5 minute opening crawl, or Christian Slater dragging around a dazed and confused Tara Reid, you cannot help but love this movie's sheer audacity for lunacy. This movie is likely to live on forever, as a cult hit. It's kinda like Plan 9 without the heart. Fun for all. I recommend it for the young. I recommend for the old. Alone in the Dark is...well, a movie.

reviews.review_title: What an amazing movie!
reviews.content: I just rented this movie movie and boy i regret it that i didn't go to the movies to see it!!! For at least five times!!! Firstly the strongest point of this movie is how well the script is bind together.The characters have their backgrounds explained extremely well and have their motive are perfectly explained.Stereotype characters like the hot-female-archaeologist and the not-wearing-armor-commando simply do no exist in this movie!!Everything is original and fresh and i am sure it will set the benchmark for all scriptwriters to follow.Academy award nominee for sure. Also the action scenes are rewriting the way the action movie genre should be made.In 1999 the Matrix came and shows as the slow-motion effects and extreme gunfight and kung-fu fight.Now in 2004 A.I.T.D. show how fighting scenes should be made using advanced slow-mo effects combined with first-year karate school class fighting.Also gun-fighting using rapidly cut-scenes so you wont understand what is happening gives more to the atmosphere of lostness in the movie.And i wont forget to note to the originality of this movies monsters (It is know that the Aliens movie that is coming out next year would steal the look of the monsters but Uwe Boll would be suing them don't worry fans!)Also by giving the special effects of the monsters a "crappy" and with "bad-motion" style makes the movie looks like some 70s classic movie where the special effects just appeared(Star wars!)This fact make this movie appear in the top sci-fi movies of all time among with the action ones.There are more to notice like the original movie scope and flawless movie pace that doesn't make you sleep but i rather watch this movie again that commenting on it.Uwe Bollyou changed my life with this movie.I want to be a filmmaker like you...Enjoy it

reviews.review_title: I did give it a chance...
reviews.content: I was one of the rare few that sat thru House of the Dead. Worst movie I'd ever seen at the time. But I don't blow off anyone without giving them a second chance, so I rolled Boll's Alone in the Dark.On more than one occasion, I had to stifle my disbelief with alcohol and a carton of cigarettes. Even then, the movie was just terrible. Halfway thru it, I wanted to pitch Heathers in the trash, simply because Slater starred in this movie. I never expect much from Reid, but Slater...my God, man...did you lose a bet or something? Script was horrible and the acting was just pathetic. I couldn't even laugh at how bad this film was, because it was beyond even that.I won't fight with those that might have liked this movie. Your opinion is your own and I graciously respect that. I just gotta ask, "Why?".

reviews.review_title: Alone in the dark you can't see this crappy movie
reviews.content: When I went to see this movie I didn't even know it was based on a video game. If it was I'm glad I never heard of it or played it, because this movie was a complete turd burger. The movie deals with Alien B SQUAD(alien designs that i think that were based of the guys art the the Aliens were based off of). They live deep underground and had been let out through a portal long ago by an ancient race. Fast forward to the future and some evil crazy scientist finds out and some how splices their genes in some orphaned children. They grow up and one of them happens to grow up to be Christian Slatter, who must have been desperate or bored cause it sure looks it. He used to ironically work for this evil type scientist and a super secret government agency that monitors the Alien B SQUAD who can't be seen in the dark. only if light is shined on them. For a added twist or just bad writing(i believe the later) his on again off again girl friend happens to be working for the evil type scientist as they collect artifacts from the acnient people the Alien B SQUAD destroyed.IF it sounds confused and way convoluted it is. Non of it makes any sense really past it's basic plot. The acting, what's there, is bad. The special effects are laughable and the aliens arn't that impressive. They almost look like the demon dogs from Ghost Busters except a bit bigger and a little uglier. And for added stinkage wait for the pathetic love scene that comes out of no where with Slatter and the female lead. Both me and my brother who went to see it just went "Huh?" If you want to see a movie that doesn't make much sense go for it. But there are way better things you can do alone in the dark.

reviews.review_title: Terrible!!
reviews.content: I've never seen a more disparate and complete mess of a movie. Alone in the Dark does a complete disservice to its video game predecessor. The portly and witty Edward Carnby of the games is replaced by a younger more hipper Carnby (also much much duller). Tara Reid plays a nothing role as Aline Cedrac and adds nothing to the story. Stephen Dorff who I've always liked was very disappointing. Worst of all is the direction of the movie. For some reason, the movie can't decide whether or not it wants to be an action thriller, a haunted house movie, an Alien-ripoff or an Indiana-Jones-flavoured film. And it seems to focus a lot on the extra characters who've never been properly introduced. At the end, when the extra characters die, we never really feel a thing for them. The monster effects were adequate but unimpressive. The ending made absolutely no sense. Please do not watch this movie. Two hours of your life depends on it.

reviews.review_title: Awesome
reviews.content: This is probably the best action movie I've seen yet. It wasn't any Alien but it was still worth seeing it. If you haven't seen it, rent it. This movie is more action than horror. Its violent too. I thought the effects for the zeno's was quite impressive. The storyline is pretty good as well. After seeing House of the Dead I thought this movie would suck. So I rented it, and my jaw dropped. This was way better than I expected. The soundtrack is quite impressive as well. If your not in to metal, than this wouldn't be for you. The dude that posted that other comment that said this movie sucked is full of crap. He's a freaking critic just like my sister. Trust me. Its worth watching.

reviews.review_title: Let Mr. King Have A Go At It!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.content: This director must be retarded! Did he even play the games?!? I think NOT. It's a shame, this could have been a really great movie, but Uwe boll failed big time. I had a hard time staying awake during this sorry excuse for a motion picture. What happened to the real story from the game? What happened to Edwards Carnbys mission? Now the only thing we see in the theater is Christian Slater running around like the incredible talentless actor he is with no real purpose at all. The plot is ridiculous, the acting is hopeless and the entire motion picture is a disgrace to any theater with just a little self respect.The only thing i see brought from the games are the names of some of the characters. Like Edward Carnby. We can only hope that Stephen King will have a go at this great story! And that he will play the games before directing! Shame on you Uwe!

reviews.review_title: Oh Dear God, Make It Stop!!!!
reviews.content: OK, there are "Bad" movies that can still be entertaining, this was proved with the Resident Evil franchise (which of course is also an adaptation of the video game of the same name) and just about any Jean Claud Van Dam movie. That being said, this movie was 96 minutes of pure unadulterated trite drivel.The three "Stars" of this film, Slater, Reid & Dorff seem to have no connection to their characters what so ever, it's as if they are walking clichés. They would have been better off wearing name-tags throughout the movie stating, "Hi, I'm a grown man with a tortured past", "Hi, I'm cute Archaeologist that can read 10,000 year old hieroglyphs like it was plain English", "Hi, I'm Stephen Dorff, and the only emotions I know how to play are anger and rage". By the way, those were the "Spoilers", yea, this movie is "Deep"! To sum all this up, I think if Hollywood is going to make anymore movies based on video games, they should look into games with better story lines, or potential. Such as Max Payne, Splinter Cell or the Myst/ Riven series, because this movie could be considered a "War Crime" under the Geneva Convention.

reviews.review_title: Awful video game tie-in movie.
reviews.content: This was a very disappointing film tie-in with the Alone in the Dark video games. Too much happening in too short a space of time with little regard paid to continuity of story. The evil doctor is seen at one point injecting himself with the blood of one of the evil creatures but at no point is it explained why he is doing this, the director would be better suited to directing pop videos. It also features what now seems to be the norm amongst horror directors, the 'They all die at the end' shock feature. I ask you, what's the point of sitting through 90 minutes of watching characters battle all manner of unbelievable creatures only for them to die in the last 10 seconds of the film. My rating for this film, pants, and cruddy smelly pants at that.

reviews.review_title: Boredom Awakens!!! Beware!!!
reviews.content: I have indeed seen the movie Alone in the Dark today. The infamous film by the infamous Uwe Boll. As the tagline on the DVD states: 'Be aware'. Well, that's probably the only thing correct for the whole film. You've probably heard numerous people say it was THAT bad... and how much I'd like to tell you it's 'not that bad'... sorry... it is...Christian Slater frolics around looking gloomy with a strangely misplaced buckle on his coat. Tara Reid is of as much importance as a 'number 10'-button on a cellular phone. To be quite honest, one of the only bright spots was Stephen Dorff, who seems to be wanting to make the best out of it. Yet his lines are dull, his character is dull and his screen time is dull.Well so much for the actors. Now the 'battle'-scenes. The strange 'music video'-look of the battle was one that made my toes curl. The combination of shorts shots and metal, happily causes epilepsy, but is above all: USELESS. These action sequences add as much as a nipple twist on Normandy Beach. It actually just makes you want to see the next scene, before you start foaming your mouth and imitating Old Yeller.Off course, as soon as you see the text crawl at the beginning, you're in for a good laugh. The 'plot' is one of the most horrible ones I've ever heard of. There's is no structure, no twists, just a lot of running and screaming an silly extra's from dawn of the Dead (1978).The continuity was simply retarded, the special effects were okay, but seen before, not inventive and way too dark(Yes, Alone in the Dark, I get it).The truth is, there is almost nothing good about this film, yet I will gladly award it 2/10. It has been a very long time since the last time I was happy seeing credits.

reviews.review_title: kept waiting for it to get good
reviews.content: unfortunately, no luck. No real plot, ending that makes sense, etc. I mourn the brain cells that dies while watching this. I thought that Christian Slater did a decent job with his role, and Tara Reid was not bad at all, but there were so many things in the movie that just did not make sense. Generally, there's something in the film that will tie everything together and bring you to an 'aha!' moment, but that never happens. I a tempted to think that, perhaps, this script was written, in bits and parts, by different people who never met, and them kinda band-aided together to see just how wrecthed a product they could make. In Summation: this movie would make an excellent replacement for Gitmo in terms of torturing the bad guys.

reviews.review_title: Looks like somebody's been watching too many Saturday morning cartoons
reviews.content: Alone in the Dark is proof that people really need to see things for themselves before judging them. I remember the movie lasting barely two weeks at the box office, and getting a 1% rating at Rotten Tomatoes.com. After listening to my friend's rambling about how this was the worst movie ever made, that the director Uwe Boll needed to be be loaded as cargo on a kamikaze plane, I decided to stay clear of it entirely.Well, by some funny accident, I saw it anyway. I rented Shaun of the Dead last night and found a DVD for Alone in the Dark sitting snugly in its place with "Haha, LOSER," written across disk instead. I figured that since this would probably be the only time I would ever be able to see it, because I would have never rented it on my own time.I must admit that having extremely low expectations had something to do with it, but I didn't find this movie to be nearly as bad as most people said it was. Sure folks, it's bad, maybe even Razzie worthy, but it had enough style to stay entertaining. The movie opens up with some painfully slow text that moves up the screen, spoon-feeding you the plot within 60 seconds. One thing to note is that this was actually a bit of a bonus, because without it the actual movie would have been too confusing to stand. The action sets in fast enough, and our main hero does battle with some random character who's role isn't even made clear until HALFWAY through the film. That's the major weakness of Alone in the Dark. The plot and story telling isn't exactly solid gold, it's more like rusted copper. The movie is inept, confusing, hard to follow for the first 30 minutes. There are a lot of things that could have made it much better. A different style of editing, better music, and some proper research on military tactics and protocol could have really done wonders for the whole project.As far as acting, the only thing it has going for it is Christian Slater, who pulls off a great performance. The rest of the cast is mediocre at best, and the line delivery is sometimes clumsy enough to land most of them in a special education school.The score is about twice as messy as the script for the film. It's horrible, and the guy who composed it should be doing music for elevators. The action that goes with it is some of the most stylish and entertaining I've seen, but a lot of it is pointless, and just isn't a part of the story. The monsters themselves are extremely cool, and for the first time since The Lost World we're reminded that shading and atmosphere are just as important as the CGI itself. It's damn good, and the creatures look realistic enough to be put in a zoo.On that note, there's enough in Alone in the Dark for me to enjoy it at least, but it's a mess of mindless action, horrid writing and some of worst music I've heard in a long time.4/10 stars

reviews.review_title: At least it was only 90 minutes
reviews.content: Horrible, horrible movie. The plot is awful and makes no sense. Sketchy doesn't even begin to describe the lack of character development. There is no reason to get attached to any of the characters as there is no real substance to any of them, even Slater's.This is all without even mentioning the acting. From the beginning when Tara Reid forced out her first wooden lines, I knew I was in for quite a peach. If people can get paid in Hollywood to write, direct and act in piles like this, I should change careers. If you ever have the choice between watching this movie at home on your couch and watching the couch, I'd recommend the latter.

reviews.review_title: Please no more
reviews.content: The only good thing about watching this film is that I will never, ever have to spend any future amounts of my time considering whether to watch it again.The plot has more holes than a string vest, you are left wondering 'Whats going on?' because of the randomness of the story. As this was taken from a computer game I can only assume the game crashed upon loading because i've had more fun watching the Windows 'Blue screen of death'.some films are bad, some films are so bad that they become cheesy and fun, this film goes beyond that and watching it becomes an excruciating period of self mutilation and torture.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie ever
reviews.content: WORST MOVIE EVER!!!!!!! Good actors (for the most part) and director ruined by a crappy script, thats right people, i said CRAPPY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! oh dear god, this should be used as torture in prisoner of war camps. Do u remember in one of the Adams family movies where they try to turn Wednesday and Pugsley normal by making them watch that Disney crap? well they could do that, but only it would be to destroy them and turn their brains to mush, thats right, MUSH!!!!!!!! I guess I'm being kinda harsh, I mean it wasn't that bad, it could have been worse, I mean they could have cast Britney spears as the female lead!!!!!!!

reviews.review_title: Uwe Boll, please stop! Please?
reviews.content: This is how I can unbiasedly say that Uwe Boll is a bad director. I went to go see "Alone in the Dark" without knowing anything about the movie. (I kind of thought the poster looked cool, and anyway, the game was kinda fun.) When the movie was not boring me to sleep,(I mean it, I fell asleep at least twice.)I was laughing at the corny lines, fake looking CGI, bad acting, and totally overblown action scenes. The whole theater collectively groaned at times! As I left the movies that day, I was so disgusted with the quality of the film I had just seen, I had to go online and find out who made this monstrosity. Turns out, it was the same guy that made that stinker a few years ago, "House of the Dead". I actually bought that movie for the sole purpose of making fun of it. Now I find out he's making more of these films. The more I find out about him, the more he reminds me of Ed Wood. Please, Uwe, please, stop making movies if you can't make them right!!!

reviews.review_title: The epitome of bad film-making.
reviews.content: Remember those fantasies you had as a kid? You were a soldier in the Elven army of another world; your parents smiled as you tried to explain to them this concept that only your mind fully understood and had formed backstories on.Well, watching Alone in the Dark, I couldn't help but remember this. Regardless of the extremely poor acting (characters express emotion by moving their eyebrows up and down) and bad lines; regardless of the ridiculous slow motion scenes that made the audience fall of their chairs laughing; regardless of poor animation, plot, concept and non-originality; the movie plays out just like one of those childhood fantasies.You get the feel that only Boll knows exactly what is going on; everyone else is led in a whirlwind of nonsensical crap. OK, so the Abkani are an ancient civilization and were wiped off the face of the planet. OK, now we've found out that this guy was an orphan. Wait, what was the deal with that old guy and the mutinous crew? Oh, a bloodthirsty creature escaped? Wait, it's afraid of light? Huh? Also worth mentioning, there is a major blooper in the end that is so glaring you wonder how anyone, even Boll, missed it; the creatures, which are said to avoid daylight as "prolonged exposure to sunlight is lethal"; the creatures are shown shying away from even gun-mounted flashlights. However, in the ending scene, which is set in bright sunlight, the protagonists are rushed and killed by a creature. Wait, what's that about exposure to sunlight? In the end, everyone exited in pretty much high spirits caused by the movies gut-bursting, unintentionally funny scenes; the only sorrow we felt was wasting $10 on this.

reviews.review_title: Waste of time and money.
reviews.content: This was a total waste of time. If the director had followed even a tiny morsel of the storyline of the VG, it might have been okay. Even if he'd tried to focus a little bit more on the horror of the "xenos" and not smother the plot in guns and explosions, he might have gotten away with some of the gratuitous "lets blow things up" stuff, but this was an excruciatingly dull film. The director manages to miss on every cue that might make this film worth watching. The camera-work is inept at its best. The storyline is sorely absent. The whole "bureau" deal makes the story even less credible than it is in the VG. Giving the protagonists a half-baked and totally unmotivated love interest makes it even more pathetic. None of the horror, the disturbing atmosphere of the huge estate or the creepy feeling of paranoia manages to push through dense wall of "running about guns blazing" that that is unequaled even in the western genre, or indeed in war films. Every minute of it seemed like an hour, and if I see another lame explosion like all the ones in this film, I'll throw up.

reviews.review_title: Important news for Uwe Boll
reviews.content: Okay I really have to say that Alone in the Dark confused the heck out of me, but it wasn't that bad. I must say that I'm noticing a frequent occurrence in your movies (House of 1000 corpses, Alone in the Dark and Bloodrayne) They all have similarities that I'm going to point out whether this helps you out or not. 1: The use of to much blood. (If it starts to look like a can of red paint exploded, or looks like someone cleverly painted *blood* on a scene you have gone overboard) 2: The use of useless and or random sex scenes. (I personally think that a good movie doesn't need this, and if a movie really needs to have one of these scenes then it should be classified as porn) 3: Horrible continuity problems. Please check your films carefully after filming. In Alone in the Dark the sand worm scene when the lady was killed by the sandworms and left to die just before the last person leaves you see her start to get up. Hello, didn't she just die? Oh and watch that the script matches the movie. The last scene when Christian Slater says "The gate had finally been closed" Umm it was blown up, not closed. I could honestly keep telling you what you need to check before sending the film to print, but I think others will have their say soon enough. The noted 3/10 means that I personally think your work has improved. It is also rather low to show that it still needs work, but it's getting there!

reviews.review_title: Fire the lighting director
reviews.content: The careers of Stephen Dorff, Christian Slater, and Tara Reid officially ended with the making of this "film." The lighting was on par with local attorney and car dealer TV ads, and the CGI department didn't have a big enough budget to sugar-coat what appeared to be a 17 year-old film student's mid-term project. Glasses do not make Tara Reid appear either literate or remotely intelligent. She also runs like a duck. Also, poor choice in having two height-deficient actors playing lead roles amongst a cast of primarily tall people. The bond that Dorff and Slater make half way through the film is completely forced and unbelievable. Don't let the pretty packaging deceive you in the rental store!

reviews.review_title: Just terrible
reviews.content: I'd probably go on a long rant like the other reviewer if I'd paid to see it or watched it all the way through 30 mins was plenty enough to know just how awful it was going to be

reviews.review_title: So bad.
reviews.content: This was one of the worst movies I have ever seen. Bad cgi, bad actors, bad lines, bad story, ... it has it all.It seems like Christian Slater is not only losing hair but also credibility by the minute. It should be possible to make a good movie out of the original story, but it seems they never tried, and found out how to make a sci-fi horror movie which spreads horror itself.My biggest horror was sitting out this movie. I showered myself for hours after seeing this movie, as if I was raped through my eyes. I tried to find out if this form of publishing can not be seen as an act of violence, but I fear they have their lawyers ready.This movie should be banned from shops at once and destroyed without any trace or we will feel ashamed forever.Think about our children and do the right thing.

reviews.review_title: Worst. Movie. Ever.
reviews.content: No worries about spoilers here. You'll figure out all you need to know about this film in the first five minutes. You might be tempted to watch on, thinking innocently that no screenwriter over age 11 would write something this formulaic. And, after all, Christian Slater's in it, and he wouldn't star in it if it was a total stinker, would he? You'd be wrong.I will devote the rest of this post to making sure you don't even waste even a second of your time (not to mention the $4 charge at Blockbuster) watching this misbegotten train wreck of a movie. Look at it this way: I suffered thorough it to spare you, my dear reader. You may thank me later.This movie manages to make even the rock-bottom standards for any movie based on a video game seem set, by comparison, impossibly high. I've never played "Alone in the Dark," but I can only hope that the plot, acting and special effects are better than the movie version. The only thing that doesn't fall short of expectations is Tara Reid. I don't mean that in a good way.There's no camp value or unintentional humor to redeem it -- unless you count the grim fascination of seeing the once-promising Christian Slater at the absolute nadir of his acting career. The closest parallel I can think of is Courtney Love, who at least lifts her shirt every now and then to justify her existence.If you want scary, rent the far superior straight-to-video "Dead Birds". Or just turn off the lights and sit in a closet by yourself for two hours.

reviews.review_title: Utter filth
reviews.content: For a movie that was supposed to be based on the game they did a horrible job. I played the game all the way through both on 3DO and PC. Initially I was excited to see that they had made a movie based on one of my old time favorite games. As I was watching I just kept thinking, I should have just been happy that I liked the game, and not wasted my time watching the movie. There were only a couple vague similarities between the game and the movie. They mostly reside in the character name Edward Carnby. In the game the owner of the mansion, which you never saw in the movie, had opened a hell mouth and hellish beings were crossing into our plane and into his house. He was killed by the beings, but not before he was able to get a hold of one of the two investigators you could play as. When the game started you began in the attic of the old manor. and had to work your way out past ghosts, hell hounds, winged demons, and a smörgåsbord of other hellish creatures. Somehow they drifted pretty far away from that in this truly time wasting movie.

reviews.review_title: Laughable at best.
reviews.content: I saw this movie on a whim, and should have realized the mistake i made when i walked into the theater, only to discover i was only 1 of 3 couples.The movie was confusing, the graphics were only so-so. the soundtrack was out of place, my personal favorite was the 80ish grunge rock sex scene! Evidently it was based on a video game, which i can only hope no one bothered to buy. Hopefully Stephen Dorff will decide to go into hiding for awhile and emerge in something worthwhile. poor poor Christian slater....who's looking older and older with a receding hairline.Go see this only if your looking for a movie you can talk and laugh through, and maybe you should be a little drunk.

reviews.review_title: So terrible I had to make my friends watch
reviews.content: This movie was one of the most ridiculous films I've seen in my life. It was so awful that I actually bought it for my friend as a birthday present just so he could watch it and see how bad it is. It's bordering on the line of so bad it's funny/entertaining, but some of it is just too boring to even get us there. It actually wasn't as horrible the second time I watched it, but it was still the worst movie I can remember seeing. If you ever get really bored and want to purposefully rent something bad, this might be a good option for you. BUT I would have to suggest you check out "I Drink Your Blood" instead, it's about a bunch of hippies who get rabies from meat pies then try and kill everyone in the town, top notch entertainment.

reviews.review_title: Worst in a good way!
reviews.content: OK so i have read almost all of the reviews on this movie and i have to say that i agree with all of them. However, i actually quite enjoyed this movie. Sure it is too slow in some places and it does seem to drag on. It makes about as much sense as an LFO song and the plot has so many holes that it makes Larry the Cable Guy's underwear look good. But i didn't have to think for an hour and a half. If you are looking for a good thriller or horror movie then this definitely is not for you. But it you are looking for a movie that you can make out to or just shut your brain off then watch this. Now that being said I would not spend money on it but i got it for my b-day. anyhow that is what i think!!!

reviews.review_title: A Bad Combo
reviews.content: I don't know how this happened, i mean; two awful movies in a row from the same director .I was not aware of Uwe Boll's work till I watched "Houseof the Dead", one of the worst movies I ever watched, the next day i rented "Alone in The Dark" not knowing that he was the director, what are the odds for that?, Oh boy, what can I say about it, at the beginning it was absolutely cheap, the dialogs were poor, the photography had nothing to do with dark stuff, it was full of light colors, like a comedy perhaps, I noticed some resemblance with House of the Dead, the loud music issue, the blood, the bad copy of matrix scenes, the only good stuff was a little bit of the music included in the game. I know that Silent's Hill director was a fanatic of S H, that was one of the main reasons to hire him. What I really wanna know is if this Uwe Boll is familiarized with games, as far as I'm concerned he made 3 movies based on video games, I didn't watch Blood Rayne yet, are the developers of the games not watching the movies or what?,maybe he's a cool gamer but as a director sucks big time, he doesn't know how to end a scene, his endless totally senseless scenes are really boring. I think this guy should be banned or something, from now on if i see his name on a film, I won't rent it even if it is my favorite video game. Well maybe I'll watch some of his work, to learn what should not be done in a movie.

reviews.review_title: Don't waste your dough
reviews.content: After reading the jacket of this movie, it sounded very good. After watching it, I was furious because I payed money to purchase such an awful movie. The director is inept and leads to a very poor performance by the actors. I was aghast at the performance of ALL the actors involved. There are so many plot holes that the entire film is laughable. Absolutely no character development. I was so disappointed because this could have been a truly great film. On the flip, I have to give kudos to the vfx team because they did an enormously fantastic job. In fact, the vfx are the only thing that make the movie interesting. In summary, the movie was hugely disappointing and I was furious at how poorly done it was. If you want to check it out, rent it, don't buy it because it's not one to keep in your collection. Seriously disappointing, and the director is to blame.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies ever made
reviews.content: This movie is a complete and utter waste of time. Boring and sleep inducing. I actually fell asleep twice trying to watch it.Stephen Dorff clearly just needed a paycheck. There is no reason for him to appear in just a shoddy film. Ditto for Christian Slater. He hadn't been seen much until this one..... why try to make a comeback with this?Tara Reid is hideous in her role. She's completely unbelievable as a "smart" woman and needs to just play bimbo roles until she retires.The monster weren't scary. The film wasn't scary -- except for Tara's acting. This movie is a joke.I think this film may be on my list of all time worst movies. I will probably never again see a video game inspired movie after seeing this one.

reviews.review_title: Oh dear,Oh dear Oh dear!
reviews.content: I cannot stress enough that this movie is nothing more than 90 minutes of utter mess.I had just finished playing the AITD playstation2 game and i enjoyed it immensely so of course was looking forward to the film.Not only does it disappoint on every level it is the worst time i have had sitting in front of a film trying hard not to turn it off!After the complete and utter mess they made of the Resident Evil movie i thought that film makers would learn from its many mistakes.But sadly no.The viewer can only feel sorry for themselves in having to sit through this total chuff.No excitement,no suspense,no shocks and no scares....this film is a frightening as putting on a hat.Please heed my warning.AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

reviews.review_title: I can't believe this guy...
reviews.content: And that's not just because of his non-existing talent... Well actually, having heard a lot about the guy, this is the first movie i've seen that he has done and... jeeesus! I have never ever felt less involved in a movie before (and i've seen a lot of crap in the same genre). Nothing works, nothing makes sense, nothing reaches the viewer and the "sex-scene"... well... that's just... hmmm.But back to my first line. The thing i'm referring to is that he actually think of himself as good. He really thinks that his movies are good... i mean, seriously.... what's wrong with him? From what i've been reading about him, he's like a 5 year old boy. "if you don't like what i'm doing you're all just stupid and you should be beaten up". If anyone's retarded it's clearly him.And the mystery no one understands: Why on earth do all the well-renowned actors want to work with this guy???I'm sorry that i can't help you guys there. It's a mystery on the line with the pyramids and other "wonders" of the world.

reviews.review_title: X-Files ripoff, without the acting to back it up.
reviews.content: What this movie didn't have: Actors that can do more than speak stilted 'hero-speak'. Plot that in any way relates to the AitD games or Lovecraft stories. What it did have: Two uncalled-for gunfights with automatic weapons. One 15-second love scene in the middle of everything. Special effects reminding me of The Mummy (the first one). After watching House of the Dead, I was wary to see this movie. But eventually, I couldn't help but check it out to see how badly Mr. Boll managed to mangle _this_ old favorite game series. Even prepared, it left me with a bad taste to have wasted an hour and a half on .. this.

reviews.review_title: Based on...?
reviews.content: The feeling of isolation from the game fails to be achieved in the movie. The term "based on" has been totally misused in the case of this film, and I am disappointed about Christian Slater playing lead in a movie like this. Though unsurprisingly the quality of this movie is fitting for an actor like Tara Reid.Whereas the original game had a cthulhu-mythos atmosphere - Dank and Heavy ambiance - this movie seems like a combination between "Blade" and "X-Files" gone haywire.I hope they don't make a sequel. I would rather have they make this one over, and place the setting in the start or middle of the 20th century, in the mansion where it all takes place in the game, so that the movie for a twist actually might become true towards its original source. Otherwise Toybox made fine effects. The SFX were OK, but the soundtracks were really bad. Only great part musically is at the end of the movie. So you'll be looking forward to the end of the movie. Can't tell which band it is, or I would be spoiling the greatest part in the movie... or should I say after the movie!

reviews.review_title: Absolutely Terrible
reviews.content: This is, perhaps, the worst movie I have ever seen. And I have seen Doom and Plan 9 From Outer Space.We start with a prologue containing more text than any opening scroll should have. It's longer than all the Star Wars scrolls combined. Then we have some kids running from aliens.Cut ahead 100 years, where Christian Slater plays an angsty artifact-hunter and Tara Reid fails miserably at being a museum curator. There's some fight scenes, a random sex scene, more fight scenes, a few explosions, and a little over an hour later you're left wondering why you paid to see this movie where evil creatures who are killed by sunlight wind up attacking in broad daylight, characters run through mine shafts that take 30 minutes to climb down and 5 minutes to climb back up, and continuity errors abound.Not to mention the scene where a "dead" soldier, killed by evil creatures, starts to stand back up.See it only for the laughs, and borrow it if you can--don't spend money to see it.

reviews.review_title: Comment on Alone in the Dark MOVIE
reviews.content: I did play the Alone in the Dark 3 PC game and unlike other I throughly enjoyed the game and has since become one of my favorites. I did think the game could have been improved, but the concept was interesting. I think with a little imagination the "idea" could have been affectively been done in film with a minimal budget. Special effect would unfortunately been necessary (Computer animated!).What bothered me the most was that it did not follow the intense adventure theme as was portrade in the game. Too much AK action, and not the "alone in the dark" of a separated couple idea. There were no Vietnam troops!!, and it was not necessary to attempt to follow the Alien film. Many parts of the game where ignored; I think they could have been incorporated, or followed the game more precisely.

reviews.review_title: Why, God.... Why?
reviews.content: Conflicted, confusing, and confounding, 'Alone In The Dark' had me hanging on from the outset in hopes of finding at least ONE plot thread that could connect with another. Not being aware that there was a preexisting video game of the same name probably didn't help this viewer, as a slight 'heads-up' in terms of proposed intentions might have assisted in making some sense of this garbled train wreck of a film, but even that remains dubious.Christian Slater phones-in one of his better phoned-in performances, Tara Reid almost outperforms a novice porn actress in terms of line-delivery, and Stephen Dorff is, well, just too small a man to fill the character assigned to him. In fact, every aspect of this contrivance is conspicuously scaled-down. The actors seem diminutive not only in performance ability, but in actual physical stature. Slater seems small in his leather duster, Reid resembles a tweenage shopper at the Monster Mall, and Stephen Dorff is.... well, Stephen Dorff. Having seen 'Cecil B. Demented' one can hardly shake the image of him as a mini megalomaniacal director - and his attempts in 'Alone' at being a grizzled Squad Leader fall short. Pun intended. Even the monsters are smaller and less-capable as they alternate from terrifying, omnipotent uber-menaces to clumsy, dog-like henchmen from scene to scene.Unlike similar disjointed efforts that can provoke laughs because of preposterousness, this one only provokes groans. From the Magna Carta-sized screen text at the beginning, to the Hessian Aggression Heavy Metal end theme, this film-making team should be chastised for not having donated their budget to a charitable foundation instead of releasing this annoying spectacle.

reviews.review_title: Uwe should be left Alone in the Dark
reviews.content: Everything this guy touches turn to crapola!!! They're horror based games, not sci fi fantasy!! WHY DO YOU KEEP TAKING ON A GENRE YOU AREN'T EVEN FAMILIAR WITH???!!! It's like making Batman Begins, but basing it on a guy with super powers who grew up on a farm in kansas...oh, wait, he has to be a journalist as well. When i first played House of the Dead in 1997, i was already thinking what an awesome movie it would be...that there was no way to screw it up b/c the plot and the characters and the style was already laid out for a film. anyone who has seen the movie would know what i mean. This guy has no business making films in general.

reviews.review_title: Not to bad
reviews.content: I really don't understand all the bad reviews on this one. Sure it's not the best movie ever, nor is it the worst. I mean I just don't get some people. Lately the trend in horror movies is Child sees ghost, and or Child is a ghost.These ghost movies are really starting to annoy me to no end. Back in the 1980's Alone, would have been considered a generic monster flick. Well, we haven't seen one for a while now, so to me, this movie seems strangely new.I own over 600 horror movies on DVD/VHS, and I will also own this one. Lets face it, the movie didn't break any new ground, but it didn't rehash the current trend of Americanized Japanese movies, or PG rated movies about kids seeing evil spirits that do nothing except attack and then fade to black, leaving the audience asking "What the heck just happened?" or "Did she die?" Etc.Anyway, if you're looking for a fun movie, then go for it. If you want a more serious horror go see SAW. Or rent John Carpenters THE FOG or something from the silver age of film-making!

reviews.review_title: There has never been a video game as terrible to play as this movie was to watch.
reviews.content: Though, if you have played the game this was loosely based one, you will be even more disappointed. The game was very good. It was the first time I ever had to barricade a door from zombies.For watching this movie I recommend you find a player that will display subtitles on 4x speed and simply waste a quarter of the time you would have lost otherwise. It is slow, poorly acted, worse than any made for TV movies I've ever seen. The creature effects simply make me sad because there were obviously some talented artists working on this poop. I feel that a film like this just wasted a whole lot of time for every one who touched it. Actors, technicians, designers, camera people, caterers... just consider that team of people who had to build that really scary monster and make it jump around and kill those people no one cares for. When the story is this bad... it's as though someone is spraying all their hard work with diarrhea.I believe someone decided to make this movie terrible on purpose. Starship Troopers meets The X-Files put in a blender with yes.. extra poo. Perhaps a producer decided that he hated a small or large group of people (also audiences in general) and that the best way to punish them was to make this movie and put all their enemies in it. Christian Slater should not be in movies this bad. I wish I had just watched pump up the volume again instead.In conclusion: even if you hate video games, your time would be better spent playing them than watching this piece of garbage.

reviews.review_title: Alone in the Toilet
reviews.content: The screen turns black, and you tremble with fear. Then suddenly, a narrated plot summary within the first 5 minutes scrolls across the screen, obviously included because without it no one would have any idea what the hell is going on in the movie.The intro to the main character is a joke, the horrible cheese-tastic forced dialogue with a line like "your mom is wrong, kid" begs to be laughed at. Tara Reid tries to act intelligent in this movie, but you can only imagine how many takes it took her to pronounce the word "archeologist." The "action" sequences are impossible to analyze, basically amounting to chopped together scenes of people firing guns. Some "bullet-time" have been so overplayed that you almost can't wait for it to be over. Its worth watching on video to maybe laugh at, or if the video game gives you wet dreams.

reviews.review_title: I'm really disappointed with this movie
reviews.content: I was really anxious to see this movie as I loved the Alone in the Dark video games that the movie is based on. I also think that the Alone in the Dark story and world makes for a perfect Horror/Thriller/Detective movie, but don't be fooled by the genre label. We are presented with a story that I think is appropriate and interesting, but it's presented in such a bad way that you after a while has forgotten all about the story and instead wonder if you are watching a bad music video. Or maybe a children's cartoon, due to the childish comments that sometimes is made when trying to advance the plot.At one point in the movie we are also presented with a soft sex scene, which doesn't add anything to the movie, instead it's increasing the feeling that we are watching a long and bad music video.The director seams to have added the music from his own personal favorite collection without any thought of that the music should at least add to the atmosphere of the movie. But instead of scary music that adds to the tension and excitement, which should have been an element in an Alone in the Dark movie, we have to listen to cool hard rock while our invincible superhero is blasting his way through the hordes of evil monsters that is after him. Although I like the music, it totally destroys any tiny bit of atmosphere that might have been there.And what I have already briefly mentioned is that our hero, Edward Carnby, is engaged in open combat instead of trying to build up a good horror tension. A feeling of where you don't know what are out in the dark trying to get you, like in the video games, which had us all on our heels while we played them. No, Edward is never alone in the dark in this movie.The whole experience makes me wonder if the director has even played at least one Alone in the Dark game for at least five minutes. It more feels like his been disappointed by that he hasn't been chosen to make a Blade movie, and wants to show the world that he could have made a Blade movie (which isn't much to brag about), or if he has had any education in storytelling at all.I'm so disappointed in this movie that I had to sign up here, vote, and make my first review. And I feel sad for Christian Slater, who is a good actor, and really makes the best he can out of what he has to work with. And he would have been perfect as Edward under different circumstances.

reviews.review_title: If I knew then what I know now...
reviews.content: It all starts at the trip to Hollywood Video. I'm scanning for some movies to see when I come across Alone in the Dark. I check out the back and see a small pic of one of these creatures that star in the film. I don't pay attention to what actors played in it or when it came out, only that it looked like one of those movies that never hit the big screen but seemed to have decent effects. I had skimmed over the story line, catching that something to do with creatures in the dark who were going to come out and kill people. Surprise, surprise. Hey, I was in the mood for one such as this, so I rented it, and just now finished watching it.(Warning, some spoilers will pop up throughout the rest of my comments) I had been expecting bad acting and even a worse plot, but I was supposed to have demon looking creatures to keep my mind occupied. I was surprised to see a couple famous actors in the film and then my expectations soared, cause... if they were in this film, then it had to be worth it, right? WRONG. I was hoping things were going to be explained. More details about this "World of the Dark" and why would people ally themselves with them. What purpose would be to open this gate and let them run around. (Cause normally when you let creatures of the underworld out, the person doing it is expecting power of some sort) The friggin psychotic doctor or whoever he was (already I am forgetting them...thank god) injects himself with the blood of one of the creatures and from what I saw, gained nothing! Well, except that the creatures didn't go off and kill him. But other than that, nothing. He didn't seem to get any super strength, powers, or anything. If he did, the movie never showed it. POINTLESS.I still don't get what happened to Carnby, or the complete story with the orphan children deal. Then the ending... Horrible. I really can't go on.First I figured it was cause I zoned out and just missed something during my trips to get drinks and clean up. So I came on here to check out user comments and I have yet to see one comment where someone actually liked the film. If I had known this, I would have saved my 3.69! The only scene I actually liked was when Carnby's apartment went all dark, there was a pause, then the music started as Carnby and Cedrac lit up the place with their guns. It was more like a music video than anything else. I actually rewinded it and watched it again. The only two minutes I was happy during this film.Well, one thing good came out of this film. That song at the ending credits was good, but thanks to other viewers I have been warned to NOT buy the soundtrack. It would be similar to ramming a hot poker in my eye. So I am gonna find out who did that song and get it. Yay for me.P.S. This isn't even worth to catch on cable. 96min of your life will be wasted. Do something else that is productive. Like spend an extra hour in the shower. Trust me.

reviews.review_title: A terrible waste of time.
reviews.content: Here in this film I think the actors involved actually displayed a regression in their acting ability. I've seen them do much better in the past and I couldn't help but notice how often Christian Slater said 'Come on, this way' that I may have begun counting in my head just like you'd count a lecturer's 'um's and 'ah's or a bimbo's 'like's.The cinematic cut diluted the plot (though I doubt it was in any way well developed before) leaving many things unexplained and the narration was cheesy at best.The only redeeming feature of the film was that the closing credits featured Wish I Had An Angel by Nightwish. The song got me more excited than I was throughout the entire film and though a biased Nightwish fan, the premise of a film's attraction being eclipsed by its theme song than its cinematic merit indeed says much better replied to with a slight nod of the head before you turn away.

reviews.review_title: Better than a lobotomy, but only slightly
reviews.content: Instead of watching this movie I should have had a midget kick me in the crotch for 90 minutes. It's an understatement to say the acting is bad, the editing is bad, the soundtrack is bad, the plot is bad, the dialogue is bad, there are no words to describe how utterly bad this movie is - perhaps a guttural scream as you're slowly lowered into an industrial meat grinder. It's ninety minutes of my life I'll never get back and worse, I fear if my wife discovers I watched this movie she'll leave me. I'm sure I'll have nightmares for the rest of my days. This movie will have you wondering would it have been better to scratch your own eyes out. You'll be left a quivering lump, curled up in the fetal position, whimpering, wondering why, why, why did you watch this awful, awful movie.

reviews.review_title: soundtrack of the year
reviews.content: haven't and wont see the movie BUT the soundtrack contain many of the best bands on the planet. if YOU don't get this music you should justdie. the music is most likely too complex for the average automaton. if you vacuous ciphers who don't get metal have any comment it is based on ignorance and lack of insight. if your mind goes blank don't forget to turn off the sound. ever noticed that at a live gig of any type of music that the crowd gets most involved, hyped, moshes or whatever equivalent when the band plays their fastest or heaviest song. it is no wonder that metal is taking over and has become mainstream of late. at a local (sydney)big corporation CD shop there is no longer a metal section it has been incorporated into the rockandpop section. sign of the times methinks. \m/

reviews.review_title: ...pointless
reviews.content: yeah i have to say that this is probably the worst adaption EVER and it was made so poorly!! i even enjoyed Fantastic Four more than this. i have to point out as I'm sure everyone has that there is some pretty damn bad editing as well. I'm not sure if anyone else noticed but still its pretty bad .i mean cmon! its too obvious!! i enjoyed the games and this just ruined it for me. this film just does not do the games justice and all they needed to do was spend a bit more time on it and it would have been a bit more productive, but still, after all this, it's not that bad for a first watch and my friends and i enjoyed laughing at how bad it was :( :)

reviews.review_title: From Action game to a good Action movie!
reviews.content: Since I live in Sweden, I wasn't even aware that this movie had been released until my boyfriend so kindly showed me IMDb to then discover all this negative criticism. So I decide to BUY the movie and see it for myself if it actually could be THAT bad. To then discover that it's like any other Video Game movie. Resident Evil and the follower Resident Evil: Apocalypse is video game based movies that has an actress who started her career as a model. Now, Tara Reid has actually worked within commercials. I'm not saying that it makes her a better actor, but please, she is better then Sarah Michelle Gellar who plays Buffy - the big blonde vampire slayer. They even made a follow up and movies out of Buffy. Who wants to see a follow up on her demonic boyfriend Angel who can be compared with Vin Diesel's so called "acting". None of them can act. Angel probably even acts better then Vin Diesel and guess what those two has in common! Bad acting and good looks! So what if we would see a follow up on Aline Cedrac? Alone with Aline? Or Alone with Aline: 2? My point is exactly that no one cares about acting in an "all action" movie or series! They want to see blondes and good-looking guys that kicks some bad guys/girls in a amazing way!So there are a few glitches in the story, but this movie should have been a longer movie with more background. Other from that, I can't see what there is to complain about. All in all, who can make a Vide Game better then this or then Resident Evil? I doubt anyone could do this movie better when it comes to effects and actresses or actors. All that is needed, is someone who could have directed them more. Because to blame the actor to be bad is easy, but this is not one of those movies where they lack in talent. This is a movie where the one to blame is Uwe Boll, because he should have used the actors and the actress to give their full ambition in this movie. So, if any of you out there, is so sure that this movie is bad, I would like to know how you ever could get a Video Game movie as the games. Because I am sure that no one can make a video game movie as good as the video game.So all I can see is a lack of directing and story. Other from that, this movie is completely action! And that what was I expected. Because that's what video games is about, right? And I believe Tara Reid acts better then that character on your video game. So unless your character in the game can give such a pretty face as Tara Reid can then you have nothing on the Alone in the Dark-movie. If you didn't want anyone to put a face on your characters, then you should keep yourself to the video game and not the movie. In which, I doubt you would even play the game if it wouldn't contain action.It's an action movie. What did you expect? What Uwe Boll did, was to make the game into a action movie. A >action< movie. I want to point out that the action movie contains special effects, monsters and a lot of guns and >action<. So if you didn't know, a video game being all action and being made into all action can't be as bad as everyone points out.I like it. Why? Because I bought an action movie and got an action movie.If there were one movie that was the biggest joke in the universe it would be "Boa vs. Python" and not at all "Alone in the dark".

reviews.review_title: The worst movie made in... well... ummm... EVER!
reviews.content: My word! I'm quite surprised how this movie managed to get higher than one star no to mention two... Its not even really a B-rate movie, rather than an imitation of one, and at that its a horrible imitation of even that... The story is told in a way that doesn't really catch the attention of anyone, and the core of the film is blood and guts, with a sprinkling of some amazing music, (I have no idea why anyone would let their music be used in something as awful as this) and flashy lights. This creates a perfect dish, if the fight has some sort of meaning... but here it seems they just randomly occur, and lots of people in cheap costumes die, in a pool of their own blood, which looks remarkably like cooking oil with coloring. This brings me to the computer graphics. I don't have much to say about this topic, other than its a load of... well fertilizer. If the guys in the CG department would have just sat around in a park counting clouds, I'm confident to say, that we would have been much better off. Thats about it for the CG. Take a look at a couple of scenes as well... for example, the gattlings are firing, but the ammo strip fails to move even a bit, while this machine doesn't even spill out any spent shells. perhaps some editing would be needed in the scene, where they just arrived at the bottom of that shaft, and one of the girls dies, when the remaining people decide to move on, just as they leave the shot, the girl starts to sit up... hmmm... isn't she supposed to be dead(?!?). In one other scene somewhere near the end of the film, when the old bloke bites the dust, a couple of shots later his corpse magically disappears! All in all, this abomination has an extreme air of cheapness... no, worse, cause if it were cheap at least it would have some character. This way tho' this is a soulless film. It tries to scare you from time to time, it even gives suspense a try, it all works out very poorly. Another shot in the gut is the acting. Not one ounce of emotion is conveyed. Not even a teeny little bit. Its like trying to cook by reading a cooking book. Let me explain. All the ingredients are there. A long line of good games, action adventure, almost everything you need in a moderately good movie, but if you're clumsy, you just will not be able to make the dis as good, as a chef would, and is not going to look anything like the picture beside the recipe. The picture being the website... i was actually expecting something a little like Silent Hill. If you've downloaded this film, and I'm pretty sure you have because it would be a waste of money to have acquired it in any other way, ill tell you what to do: open the drive that the film is on, open the directory its in, select the file, press delete, click "Yes", and empty your recycle bin. If you happen to have it on a CD, DVD, etc. and you have it on your drive and you're just about to watch it, then open the drive the disc is in, remove the disc, find the CD or DVD case, get a can of lighter fluid, go outside empty the can of lighter fluid on the disc(s) and case(es), strike a match, light the pile of filth you just layed on the ground, stand back and enjoy. Feel the comfort that your friends never need laugh at you, because they accidentally saw the file or disc or case or whatever that had the words: "Alone in the Dark movie" written on them. If i had to choose between "Alone in the Dark" or alone with a shark, well... id say: wait a sec let me get my trunks...

reviews.review_title: Simply Awful
reviews.content: I can't believe I've got the chance to watch this. Directed by Uwe Boll, (who his company claims to be the "World Market Leade in Video Game Adaptions"), it is supposed to be based on the same name of a popular video game but in reality, there is not a single reference to any of the games save the name of Edward Carnaby. The film starts with Edward Carnaby escaping from the orphanage where weird experiments are conducted on children. He escapes this and hides in an electrical outlet where he gets an electric shock. Forward some decades later and he's a paranoia detective from there he shoots zombies and monsters and finds secrets that no one else has discovered.The film starts with a scrolling prologue which lasts about 5 minutes and I must say, it was a really painful experience to watch so decided I skipped it and head straight to the action. Boy, did I find myself cringing severely. It was added after test audiences reported that they were confused by the plot (and rightfully so).The acting in this film is atrocious, some of the worst performances I have seen in the past 5 years or so. Christian Slater is completely misplaced in this film as he tries to look tough with all those guns he's holding. Tara Reid looks totally lost 100% of the time having no relevance to the film. Stephen Dorff tries too hard....'nuff said. In all, the dialogue in this film is just plain awful. The only thing I find funny in the whole of AITD is Boll's comments about Reid and looking smart with glasses.The soundtrack is again plain awful and highly inappropriate, in my opinion. It's as pointless as the film itself and bad rock music is forced in the viewer's ear. The film uses to much of it to make up for the atrocious plot. What can I say about the writing? I've seen 2nd rate fan fiction writers which are vastly superior to this.Editing: Very bad, the editing feels all choppy in general. Boll uses heavy emphasis on slow motion and very quick cuts to make any gore scenes really gruesome. Now lets go on about the direction. Uwe Boll can't direct a movie at all and this film just proves it. Every last scene is cringe worthy (except the credits when the cringe factor is diminished). He has carelessly thought up some of the most ridiculous ideas that could make the most arrogant studio exec faint. In particular, he changed the gritty, tense atmosphere (set in early 20th Century Louisianna) to an action oriented film (set in present day with a sci-fi atmosphere and a detective with loads of guns). In the original games (and original script), there was no slimy badly rendered CG monsters, no pointless gun fights, no ridiculous car chase sequence and no gratuitous sex scenes. It was him who suggested the idea to have all of these added to the film. The camera-work is also to blame for this sloppy production. It feels very nauseating at inappropriate times. For example, Boll thought it would be a good (or more accurately in his own words "excellent") idea to move the camera around when there is no action and stops still when there is action, it stays absolutely still. As a result of this, this is the cinematic equivlent to riding a roller coaster while intoxicated.My major gripe is at the end where *SPOILERS AHEAD* the monsters who are supposed to be afraid of the light attack Slater and Reid in broad daylight. Does that mean that the monsters are pretending to be afraid of the dark just to tease Slater and Reid's characters? Probably not, it's just a technical goof which Boll failed to see in the cutting room. To call his ending as "Lynchian" is an insult to the great David Lynch himself. At least with Lynch, he actually carefully thought through his ideas as he wrote his scripts. *END SPOILER*In short, Alone in the Dark is some of the worst films I've ever seen in the past 10 years. Horrible acting, dialogue, editing, direction, plot, soundtrack and much more. Boll's works will make other bad films like Manos, the Hands of Fate look Oscar worthy. I've seen Z-Grade films of similar calibre which are far better than this. My advice? Avoid this sub-par "film" and get Hostel instead.

reviews.review_title: Christian Slater must've been hurting for money....
reviews.content: One of the worst movies ever to make it to theatres(not for long). Christian Slater must've split the budget with the effects guys, because there's nothing redeeming about the story, plot, pacing, and the acting.....so bad. There's a lot of narration by Slater's character, trying to explain what's happening in the movie. "In case you didn't know, the monsters are bad, and we have to stop them! At all costs!"Rent it if you want a good laugh, and watch for a number of missed or unafforded edits such as one of the recently deceased team members moving her head at the end of a scene.....Tara Reid is a block of wood.
